lead_paragraph: The agency, citing specific episodes, said efforts by athletes to flout drug-testing programs have not stopped since Russia was accused of government-sponsored doping last fall.

headline.print_headline: WADA Accuses Russians of Additional Violations
headline.main: World Anti-Doping Agency Accuses Russian Athletes of More Violations

snippet: The agency, citing specific episodes, said efforts by athletes to flout drug-testing programs have not stopped since Russia was accused of government-sponsored doping last fall.
abstract: World Anti-Doping Agency lists additional Russian violations that have occurred in seven months since country was initially accused of running widespread state-supported doping program; track and field officials are set to decide whether to allow Russian athletes at 2016 Rio Olympics.
